choice_d: False. When the results of the experiment do not support the hypothesis, no new hypothesis based on the results must be formed and no new experiment must be conducted.

question: In the Scientific Method, you can simultaneously manipulate several variables to effectively determine their effects to the dependent variable as long as the experiment is confined in the laboratory.

choice_b: False. In the Scientific Method, you can vary only one variable at a time to effectively determine their results to the dependent variable as long as the experiment is confined in the laboratory.
choice_d: False. In the Scientific Method, you can vary only one variable at a time to effectively determine their results to the independent variable as long as the experiment is confined in the laboratory.
correct_answer: False. In the Scientific Method, you can vary only one variable at a time to effectively determine their effects to the dependent variable as long as the experiment is confined in the laboratory.

question: It is important to formulate first the hypothesis before designing and conducting the experiment.

question: Which of the Kinetic Molecular Theory assumptions best explained Boyle's Law?
